basics.name: Balbir Prasad
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am a motivated researcher and software engineer with experience in machine learning, optimization models, and software development. My work includes projects on network optimization for urban transportation, machine learning applications in biofluids, and developing AI solutions to enhance productivity. I am skilled in languages like Python and C++, and I have a strong background in leveraging technology for practical problem-solving in both research and industry settings.

work.name: Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore
work.summary: Worked with the Centre for Infrastructure, Sustainable Transportation, and Urban Planning on Network Optimization Models for Traffic and Transit.
highlights: Developed an open-source tool to simulate transit systems and predict crowding/congestion.
Analyzed passenger behavior in scenarios such as ticket price changes, delays, and cancellations.
Implemented efficient algorithms in C++/OpenMP for fare calculation, travel time, waiting time, and route occupancy.
Used Python/Pandas for visualization and validation of the simulation model.

work.name: Biofluids Lab, Indian Institute of Technology (ISM) Dhanbad
work.summary: Researching quantitative methods to detect nasal septum deviations and evaluate hydraulic resistance pre- and post-septoplasty surgery.
highlights: Developed a deep learning-based pipeline to automatically detect and quantify nasal septum deviation from medical imaging data, aiding pre- and post-surgical assessment.
Implemented a UNet architecture in PyTorch for pixel-wise segmentation of the nasal septum from 2D slices of CT/MRI scans.
Aimed to measure deviation severity and estimate airway pressure correction, enabling more accurate evaluation of septoplasty outcomes.

work.name: Plaid Inc, Tokyo, Japan
work.summary: Designed and developed an AI powered Slack bot using Node.js, Dialogflow, and GPT-4 for dynamic intent recognition and generative AI responses.
highlights: Reduced operational costs by optimizing cloud resource provisioning for the bot infrastructure on GCP using Terraform.
Integrated GPT-4 API to provide comprehensive responses for queries outside of predefined Dialogflow intents.

work.name: Mercor
work.summary: Evaluated and compared the performance of large language models (LLMs) across diverse tasks.
highlights: Benchmarked LLMs such as GPT-4o, Gemini Pro 1.5, and Claude.
Reviewed and annotated 100+ prompt-response pairs, focusing on code generation, summarization, and language translation.

volunteer.summary: Kartavya is a voluntary organisation working towards educating poor children living in slums and villages, and helping their families earn a better living.
highlights: Had a great experience, teaching maths and physics to students.
Organised cultural events and shared the joy together.

education.institution: Indian Institute of Technology, Dhanbad, India

awards.title: Microsoft Mentee
awards.summary: Worked on automating the academics course distribution and attendance management using machine learning.

certificates.name: Data structures and algorithms in C/C++

publications.name: Predicting the porosity of granite at elevated temperature using machine learning (under review).
publications.summary: Developed an ensemble of machine learning models (RF, SVM, XGBoost, KNN) to accurately predict the porosity of granite at elevated temperatures (up to 1000Â°C), achieving over 95% accuracy with low error metrics. Conducted sensitivity analysis to identify key factors influencing porosity variations.

interests.name: Machine Learning
keywords: ML in healthcare, ML in education

projects.name: Prediction of Paper Topics Using Graph Neural Networks
projects.summary: Developed a graph-based machine learning model to predict research paper topics using Graph Neural Networks (GNN).
highlights: Built a baseline classifier with feedforward neural networks (FFN) and skip connections.
Implemented custom graph convolutional layers and node classifiers.
Incorporated node features, edges, and weights into the GNN model.
Enhanced the GNN with new nodes dynamically connected to existing ones.
